H0.text: The rate of the motion is the information a student needs to differentiate between the speed and the velocity of a vehicle in motion.

H1.text: The direction of the motion is the information a student needs to differentiate between the speed and the velocity of a vehicle in motion.

H2.text: The change in the amount of motion is the information a student needs to differentiate between the speed and the velocity of a vehicle in motion.

H3.text: The amount of distance traveled during motion is the information a student needs to differentiate between the speed and the velocity of a vehicle in motion.

A4.text: Speed, the scalar magnitude of a velocity vector, denotes only how fast an object is moving, while velocity indicates both an object's speed and direction.

A5.text: To have a constant velocity, an object must have a constant speed in a constant direction.
